contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Radio station | name = XENKA-AM | image = [[Image:Xenka color.jpg|150px]] | city = [[Felipe Carrillo Puerto, Quintana Roo]], [[Mexico]] | area = [[Quintana Roo]] | branding = La Voz del Gran Pueblo | slogan = | airdate = 15 June 1999 | frequency = 1030 KHz | format = Indigenous community radio | power = 5000 W | erp = | class = | callsign_meaning = ''Noj Kaaj'' ("gran pueblo") | former_callsigns = | owner = [[Comisión Nacional para el Desarrollo de los Pueblos Indígenas|CDI]] – [[Sistema de Radiodifusoras Culturales Indigenistas|SRCI]] | webcast = | website = [http://www.cdi.gob.mx/index.php?id_seccion=1037 XENKA] | affiliations = }} '''XENKA-AM''' (''La Voz del Gran Pueblo'' – "The Voice of the Great People") is an [[Indigenous peoples of Mexico|indigenous]] [[community radio]] [[radio station|station]] that broadcasts in [[Spanish (language)|Spanish]] and [[Yucatec Maya]] from [[Felipe Carrillo Puerto]], in the [[Mexican state]] of [[Quintana Roo]]. It is run by the [[Cultural Indigenist Broadcasting System]] (SRCI) of the [[National Commission for the Development of Indigenous Peoples]] (CDI). {{Location map |Mexico |label=XENKA | marksize=7 |mark=Locator_Dot.png |lat_deg=19|lat_min=34 |lon_deg=88|lon_min=02|lon_dir=W |position=left |width=300 |float=none |background=yellow |caption= Transmitter: {{coord|19|34|N|88|02|W}} }} ==References== *[http://www.cdi.gob.mx/index.php?id_seccion=1037 XENKA] (CDI-SRCI) {{Quintana Roo Radio}} {{Mexico-radio-station-stub}} [[Category:Community radio stations in Mexico]][[Category:Radio stations in Quintana Roo]]
